intro: Elatostema lungzhouense, commonly known as the Lungzhou elatostema, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to China, specifically the region of Yunnan, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
